intro: Bladhia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered bladhia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters of three. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
